Articles.Content:
Hi,

yes this needs some work.


In other news:
I managed to confuse the server so ive to reboot it.

Note:
1.11.0 is now added to SpaceDock. Please update your Mods

5 hours ago, VITAS said:

Note:
1.11.0 is now added to SpaceDock. Please update your Mods

I feel a bit like a bowl of petunias.

3 minutes ago, TiktaalikDreaming said:

I feel a bit like a bowl of petunias.

It automatically syncs with CKAN's list now, and @DasSkelett updated that within a few minutes of the release.
Merry Christmas to you all!
Note: KSP 1.11.1 is a thing and now on SpaceDock!

I was just informed by the Datacenter:

There will be maintenance on the Router for SpaceDocks main Server. 

Start:          3. March 2021 03:00:00 CET
End:           3. March 2021 03:30:00 CET (estimate)

So thats 30 Minutes.

Please plan your Mod up/downloads accordingly.

Thank you

Edited February 15, 2021 by VITAS

Taht downtime i was talking about in my last post:

Its within the next 24h

and the site will return 404 during downtime
1.11.2 Is a thing so pleas update your mods.

Just some simple questions (that I haven't been able to figure out):

Is there a way to change the title of a mod on spacedock if you are the mod author?

Also, is there a way to not notify followers if you press 'automatically update'? For me, followers don't need to be notified if the same version of the mod is relabelled for a different version of ksp.

Any answer is appreciated.

Edited March 16, 2021 by Aniruddh

20 minutes ago, Aniruddh said:

Any answer is appreciated.

No and no.

1 minute ago, HebaruSan said:

No and no.

Straight to the point .

Also, are features like this planned, or is it never going to be a feature on spacedock?
@Aniruddh, your SpaceDock related questions have been merged into the SpaceDock Thread.

9 minutes ago, Aniruddh said:

Also, are features like this planned, or is it never going to be a feature on spacedock?

For renaming, it's a common request, tracked here:  https://github.com/KSP-SpaceDock/SpaceDock/issues/62
I would say it's somewhat likely to happen, but the development hasn't been started as far as I know.

The other one I don't think I've seen mentioned before, so it probably isn't on anyone's radar yet.

But in general, what gets added or changed with SpaceDock is down to what folks feel like doing. New folks can submit code changes anytime to add things they care about, and existing team members essentially do the same. There's no master plan of what will be worked on in the future like there is with a commercial software company. The best chance if you don't want to actually do any work is to add something to the issues list so that some team member trawling it for ideas might see yours and start coding.

i tried to sign up for spacedock, and it sent me to a page that says "

We've sent an email to the address you provided. It should arrive shortly. Once it does, click the link inside to complete your registration. If you run into any trouble, please send an email to [email protected] to get it sorted out.

Alternatively, you can use automatic email activation by sending an email to [email protected] with the subject !activate."

 and i never got a confirmation email. i sent a email with the subject !activate to try to activate it, nothing happened. i made a new account with a different email address, and the same thing happened. am i doing something wrong? thanks!

Regarding activation:

Send me a  private message here with your reg email and username on SPaceDock. Ill manualy activate you.
Sometimes Mail Providers block to many mails in fear of spam.

About renaming Mods:
mod names are reflected in links.

SpaceDock can route people even with a changed modname but i think that having people click on a link with modname A and route them to a page with mod name B will confuse them and could give the impression that the site was broken.
I generaly advise people to make a new mod and link to it from within the description area of the old one.
 

Edited March 20, 2021 by VITAS

thanks! i cant PM yet since i haven't posted enough messages though. can i post it here? my spacedock username is NPT156

Edited March 20, 2021 by NPT156
i just got enough posts i PM you
@VITAS Hey there. I noticed a new mod which is just craft files. https://spacedock.info/mod/2692/stock starship (for 1.10.x)
@VITASHere is another mod which is only a craft-file: https://spacedock.info/mod/2708/ksp stock Astra rocket 3.2 mod for 1.10.x

Hi,

The Datacenter decided to do maintenance on the Storage backend:
https://status.hetzner.com/de/incident/d26588b3-5d74-4f4f-9b91-9c87e5b88209

The site is down till they finish.
Im not pleased.

 

Called the datacenter. they look into it why its taking so long.

Still waiting for them to find the problem.

Edited May 4, 2021 by VITAS

Just got confirmation from @VITAS that SD is back up... Issue on the hosting service end has been addressed.
Please report any issues if thats not the case.

And Welcome & Thanx to the plethora of people who joined the SD Discord server to report the issue.

Edited May 4, 2021 by Stone Blue

Hi all, I'm seeking feedback from users of the site, please share your opinions. (Please try to keep it on topic, I want an answer to this specific question, not everybody's laundry list of annoyances and whatnot that I would then have to sift through. And there's also no need to point out that not every user of the site reads this thread; I fully understand that, and it will be taken into account.)

Currently if you click "follow" for a mod that is marked as being for an older game version, and then later the mod author marks the current release as compatible with the current game version, SpaceDock will notify you about this via email. (So we're not talking about a new mod version being uploaded, this is specifically about when that doesn't happen.) The email starts with "Hi there! Thought you would like to know that ModAuthor told us that version 1.2.3 of BestMod works great with KSP 1.11.2," if you are familiar with that from your inbox.

  • Have you ever clicked "follow" with the intention to wait for this specific notification?
  • Do you find this notification useful?
  • Do you find this notification annoying?

@flartis on record as not wanting this notification, and I see his point, but before removing it, I would like to make sure that would not cause problems for other users. Thanks in advance!

Edited May 8, 2021 by HebaruSan

On 5/8/2021 at 7:35 PM, HebaruSan said:
  • Have you ever clicked "follow" with the intention to wait for this specific notification?
  • Do you find this notification useful?
  • Do you find this notification annoying?

Instead of taking some action based on a poll with questionable representation... why not simply make that (or any, for that matter) notification optional? That way it's left to the users to decide if and/or when they want to get any notification.

On 5/9/2021 at 3:35 AM, HebaruSan said:
  • Have you ever clicked "follow" with the intention to wait for this specific notification?
  • Do you find this notification useful?
  • Do you find this notification annoying?

Like swjr-swis said: If it can be made an option to choose, that would be preferable. Many will want to know the latest is available while others like to stick with what they know is working for them.
